intro: Stillingia sylvatica var. spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf stillingia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to spatulate in shape, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with four petals and a distinctive, elongated style. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
